summary: An FBI incident report documenting a call from a victim of Jeffrey Epstein on August 20, 2020. The victim offered to provide information on Ghislaine Maxwell and requested assistance obtaining a 1998 flight record from St. Thomas to Newark. The FBI attempted to contact the victim but was unsuccessful, and the case was closed as 'Information Only' in October 2021.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the perpetrator from whom the caller was a victim in 1998.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The caller wanted to provide information about her.

connections.description: The victim's offer to provide information on Maxwell in relation to being Epstein's victim suggests an investigative link between them.
The document frames the caller as a victim of Epstein and a potential witness against Maxwell.

events.title: Alleged Victimization
events.description: The caller states she was a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Flight from St. Thomas to Newark
events.description: The victim seeks a flight record for a trip from St. Thomas to Newark, which she believes would be helpful for her case.

events.title: Victim Contacts FBI
events.description: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein calls the FBI Los Angeles field office to offer information on Ghislaine Maxwell and request assistance.

events.title: Case Closed
events.description: The FBI incident is closed as 'Information Only' after unsuccessful attempts to re-contact the victim.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein contacted the FBI in August 2020, offering to testify and provide information on Ghislaine Maxwell.
The victim sought FBI assistance in obtaining a 1998 flight record from St. Thomas to Newark, indicating the flight may be relevant to her victimization.
The FBI attempted but failed to re-establish contact with the victim, leading to the case being closed over a year later as 'Information Only'.
The document references an existing FBI case number (SOD-NY-3027571), indicating this information was logged in relation to a broader investigation.
The report is classified as LAW ENFORCEMENT SENSITIVE (LES), restricting its use and distribution.
